tests.name: 2.1. Client initiates three-way handshake by sending a SYN packet with correct values in its header
2.10. Client properly increases congestion window size in congestion avoidance phase
2.11. Client detects and retransmits lost data segments
2.12. Client sets SS-THRESH and CWND values properly after timeout
tests.output: Test Failed: 3584.0 != 3840 within 0 places (256.0 difference) : Incorrect setting for SSTHRESH adjustment after timeout (3584 != 3840)

tests.name: 2.2. Client has correct initial values for CWND, SS-THRESH, and Sequence Number
2.3. Data segments that client sends are not exceeding 512 bytes and on average larger than 500 bytes (for 1~MByte file)
2.4 Client should reset its sequence number to zero when the sequence number reaches the maximum value
2.5. Client sends a FIN packet after transmitting a file
2.6. After finishing connection, client responds with ACK for incoming FINs for 2 seconds, dropping packets for this connection afterwards
2.7. Client successfully transmits a small file
2.8. Client aborts the connection if no incoming packets for more than 10 seconds
2.9. Client properly increases congestion window size in slow start phase
1.1. At least 3 git commits (at least one from each group member)
1.2. Client handles incorrect hostname
1.3. Client handles incorrect port
1.4. Server handles incorrect port
3.1. Server responses with SYN-ACK packet with correct connection ID
3.2. Server has correct initial values for CWND, SS-THRESH, and Sequence Number
3.3. Server responds with ACK packets, which include the next expected in-sequence byte to receive (cumulative ACK)
3.4. Server able to receive a large file (10 MiB bytes) and save it in 1.file without delay, loss, and reorder
3.5. Server able to receive a large file (10 MiB bytes) and save it in 1.file (with reordered and delayed packets)
3.6. Server able to receive 10 small files (1 MiB bytes) in 1.file, 2.file, ..., 10.file without delay, loss, and reorder (sequentially)
3.7. Server able to receive 10 small files (1 MiB bytes) in 1.file, 2.file, ..., 10.file without delay, loss, and reorder (in parallel)
3.8. Server able to receive 10 small files (1 MiB bytes) in 1.file, 2.file, ..., 10.file over lossy and large delay network (sequentially)
3.9. Server able to receive 10 small files (1 MiB bytes) in 1.file, 2.file, ..., 10.file over lossy and large delay network (in parallel)
